name: Quantity of one adrenaline auto-injector on a prescription
title: Quantity of one adrenaline auto-injector on a prescription
description: The percentage of prescriptions for a single adrenaline auto-injector as a proportion of all prescriptions for adrenaline auto-injectors.
numerator_short: Number of prescriptions for a single adrenaline auto-injector
denominator_short: Number of prescriptions for any quantity of adrenaline auto-injectors
why_it_matters: . The MHRA remind patients at risk of anaphlaxis to carry two in-date adrenaline auto-injectors with them at all times and to replace them before they expire

Two auto-injectors are recommended in case a second dose is needed whilst waiting for the emergency services. Patients do not have to be dispensed two auto-injectors, as there will always be occasions when only one auto-injector is required such as when one pen is lost or one has expired.
By dispensing more than one auto-injector at a time this may help to ensure that patients have two adrenaline auto-injectors ready.

quantity_per_item=1
AND

bnf_code LIKE '0304030C0%BF' OR ##Adrenaline auto-injector (brand or generic) 150 micrograms in 0.15ml 
bnf_code LIKE '0304030C0%A2' OR ##Adrenaline auto-injector (brand or generic) 150 micrograms in 0.3ml 
bnf_code LIKE '0304030C0%BG')##Adrenaline auto-injector (brand or generic) 500 micrograms in 0.5ml
